start: ^Butler: So... you found me. But I didn't do it. I swear it on my final breath.
^"You’re scared. But not guilty. There’s a difference."
reveal_beeshoy: ^Butler: You’ve seen Beeshoy play both guide and fool. Ever wonder why he’s always one step ahead?
^"You’re deflecting. Still sounds like guilt to me."
^"You’re not the first to whisper that name."
deny_butler: ^Butler: I ran because I saw too much… not because I *did* anything. The truth burns, and Beeshoy lit the match.
^"So Beeshoy… he’s not just a character?"
read_butler: ^Butler: Thank you... I hoped someone would see it. Beeshoy hides behind charm—but death follows his script.
^"So Beeshoy… he’s not just a character?"
suspicion_rises: ^Butler: It is. And one that just got me killed.
player_doubts: ^Butler: Doubt me all you like… but remember who writes the story you’re living.
connecting_dots: ^Butler: Not just a character. He’s the narrator, the director… and maybe the executioner too.
final_moment: ^Butler: He won’t let me say more. You were never supposed to find me.
